item.description: It will be incredibly interesting, when all episodes are available, to rewatch and recontextualise Andor ‚Üí Rogue One ‚Üí OT as ‚ÄòThe Mon Mothma Saga‚Äô.
Frantically googling ‚Äòthe song from that bit in andor you know the one‚Äô.
A little bit of a clean-up on the blade, and a first attempt at the dreaded eye lenses. At the most, absolute maximum, only 80% cross-eyed?

‚Äú[…] your appointed festivals I hate with all my being. They have become a burden to me; I am weary of bearing them. When you spread out your hands in prayer, I hide my eyes from you; [‚Ä¶] Your hands are full of blood! [‚Ä¶] Take your evil deeds out of my sight; stop doing wrong.

Learn to do right; seek justice. Defend the oppressed. Take up the cause of the fatherless; plead the case of the widow.‚Äù

It has been weeks since I did any actual painting. I’m really not sure this effect on the pointy bit‚Äôs working, or even in keeping with the rest of the model, but it is ultimately more acrylic-on-plastic so I’m calling it a win!

I‚Äôve binged so much of Adam from North of the Border‚Äôs YouTube over the last week that I somehow find myself in the possession of both a pack of Super Sculpey and a spool of armature wire.

https://youtu.be/WBVwHezg-cg?feature=shared

Finally thoroughly cleaning and reorganising my hobby desk. It’s unclear to me how I’ve come to own quite so many paintbrushes. At least 1.5 per month back in the hobby. Do they slowly accrete from airbrush overspray?
Twice today I‚Äôve seen the cover poster for a film called Holland and wondered why they gave Nicole Kidman such a crazy fake beard.

Didn‚Äôt progress past round one in the NYC Midnight short story competition, but the judges‚Äô feedback is so good that I‚Äôm considering redrafting it and actually submitting somewhere. It‚Äôs been a long while since I had enough enthusiasm for a story to try a second take.
The notion that the age of Kings was over was a little bit silly in hindsight.
Starting to add some secondary colours now that Tyrion-paralysis has ended.

I always intended to go back to this one and do a finishing pass or two before submitting to the competition on MMF, but the thought of doing so put me off any hobbying at all for several days üòÖ. So I‚Äôm calling this guy done. This will be the hero shot. Also the first mini photo I‚Äôve ever removed the ‚ÄòWIP‚Äô tag from.

I need to find a way to use these colours in something.

https://mstdn.ca/@senanthic/114185093469873426
Sketching in the light placement for Fancy Lad‚Äôs eventual Fancy Backside. Very rough sketch. (Please only squint while viewing üòÖ)
Fancy Trousers time.
And he‚Äôll need those mittens, it‚Äôs cold in space.

Head, shoulder, knee and toes (knee and toes). It may be a royal pain trying to colour-match freehand mistakes on a stippled shoulder gradient, but here we are. It‚Äôs all just a mix of the same two paints. How bad could it get üò¨

Random midweek experiments: I wondered if I’d be able to get a smooth blend from quite dark to quite bright going brown-to-ivories, without resorting to an airbrush. I think the answer is definitely ’no’, at least with this approach. It gives its own effect though, the scratchiness of it could probably be read as weathering? I’ll have to give stippling a try.

The light this year seems odd. We haven’t even hit DST yet but it feels like I’m up too late or awake too early even in the middle of the day. A friend says they keep internally confusing it for September.
I appear to be locked into an Accidental Grimdark with this one.
Slowly stumbling towards something, I think. If you squint a bit.
Eurostar disrupted by remnants of the last world war. The writing for this season is sledgehammer subtle.
@1moremin üëã
The return of heavy, seasonal dreams and waking up exhausted from them. There should be a word for how fully mentally-engaged you feel inside that fever intensity.
NMM gold experimentation as the next random diversion I think. Definitely going to be handy to have a Truly Enormous version without any fussy small details to work things out on.
Let‚Äôs just take this panel by panel I suppose. Mess about with the Big Guy until something starts to look vaguely appropriate, then try to mimic it on his little friend.
New frens just dropped.
Part of me really wants to kitbash this whole range as 40K Imperial Guard… Rogue Trader style.
/looks at the Drogon slices… /mutters something about a bigger boat…
Any of you incredible mini-photographers have any advice on how to take a flattering hero image? https://mastodon.social/@Brennos80/114075211586949338
What do we reckon here, HobbyPals? Is the freehanding actually accomplishing anything, or just distracting from the initial pleasant simplicity?
Another incredibly quick ‚Äòtwo-tone‚Äô test.
/taps temple: can‚Äôt be a bog standard ork checkerboard if it‚Äôs tilted into diamonds, that‚Äôs clearly elf territory‚Ä¶
It‚Äôs not the tidiest highlighting job in the world, but I‚Äôm slightly irritated that this very quick two-tone ‚Äòtester‚Äô model is already looking nicer than the stuff I spend weeks on‚Ä¶
Right, enough procrastination, operation Fix The Bad Shadow begins.

I added an attempt at a cast shadow on the base, trying to emphasise that I want the scene to read as though lit from a shaft of light above, but I hated it so much that I set it aside for a full week üòÖ I think it‚Äôs just far too extreme, I‚Äôll try to soften it and lighten it to recover.
His little boots have a strap around them that I wasn‚Äôt expecting. Sudden colour paralysis.

I have, definitely intentionally, decided that he should have Very Shiny arms. Didn‚Äôt come up much in the show, but a big part of the books.

(Awkward Look Monkey Puppet dot gif)
Starting into his jerkin and only realising while taking this photo that the filigree is approximately the same width as the ridges of my fingerprints üò¨
… and of course despite having a week, I choose to leave myself with a last day sprint.
1,400 increasingly unhinged words deep now, including a plot-justified bad haiku. Might as well just ship me that first place hat now.
I mean I can‚Äôt leave him without hair‚Ä¶
Well‚Ä¶ I know what I‚Äôll be working on when I get the Farseer finished up. Can‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs even smaller. Look at that likeness though, even just primed!
When I say ‚Äòfinish the Farseer‚Äô first, I obviously don‚Äôt mean not putting any paint on that tiny little face.
Well these just look irritatingly good… /hides wallet https://www.myminifactory.com/frontier/game-of-thrones-stl-files-3340
I played corpses on multiple seasons of that show and I don’t see a single STL with my face on it. I’m writing to my MP.
Blend, blend, blend‚Äîchecks to confirm that almost nothing has changed‚Äîblend, blend, blend. What even is white?

This stretch could be a long one: the Actual White bits.

Adding blue-gray over the vibrant white primer and a lesser white to the brightest white to try to make blue-gray and lesser white look like a more vibrant white (at scale). As you do.

Deep in the ugly, patchy phase of it at the moment.
Starting on gloves and bangles. Critical aspects of any wargaming mini.

Giving the short story challenge another try. I now have one week to write 2,500 words on:

GENRE: Ghost StorySUBJECT: Always a bridesmaid, never the brideCHARACTER: A developer
I have an absurd idea that almost certainly won’t play. So obviously it’s the only thing I’m even considering.

Filling in the remaining white space on the torso. It‚Äôs only when you take the photo that you realise there‚Äôs a fair bit more imprecision than you saw with your Human Eyeball. Fair play to the YouTubers out there getting crispy lines while filming what they‚Äôre up to.
BIT BLOWY OUT.
Some delightful noises coming from my roof.
At least I can no longer hear the worrying roof noises due to the all-encompassing chimney scream.
At least one tile off the roof. Someone’s blue bin did not survive the night ü´°
Fun new game: “Is that my bin?”
That‚Äôs not ideal.
https://www.theguardian.com/tv-and-radio/2025/jan/23/an-oral-history-of-twin-peaks-david-lynch-madchen-amick-joan-chen
Expanding the red, waiting for the storm.

I can‚Äôt remember who originally shared the tip, but if you struggle (like me) to get your non-metallics to actually look ‚Äòshiny‚Äô, you can take a photo of your initial light placement on the mini and just boost the contrast to max and brightness to min. Try to match what you see with paint.
Slowly now pushing the painted contrast to better match the boosted version, trying to make the chest ornamentation seem like a distinct material from the fabric.
Never painted an elf before, space or otherwise, despite falling in love with Jes Goodwin‚Äôs art back in the day. But this little sculpt is gorgeous.
The order in which I choose to apply paint is both baffling and entirely self-inflicted.
Of course, gentle reader, he would start into some non-metallic nonsense before he even has the base colours down. The boy‚Äôs a fool.
I just assumed David Lynch was technically immortal‚òπÔ∏è
Time to put this on a loop https://youtu.be/FTUxRX6cwDk?feature=shared
Snow day light! Bright white ground, dark grey skies. A sun’s eye view.
Not often we have a ‚Äòfeels like‚Äô -7C around here.

I‚Äôm determined that 2025 is the year I actually finish painting a thing. Anything. Just one will do. I‚Äôm nominating this lil guy. Still a long way to go, but I‚Äôve stopped myself giving up in disgust and re-priming him three separate times now, so that‚Äôs progress!

One eye sees an individual bright point of light as a randomly multiplied number of copies of that point, and the other eye the same, but with both also skewed and rotated at different angles. See that the two sets now overlap and interfere together into little snowflakes and galaxies and chains.

It is, frankly, a Good and Very Suitable time of year to have astigmatism.

Right. Today is Fully Declutter the Painting Desk day so that waves of self-disgust aren’t the reason I fail to hobby.

(There will of course be other reasons).

The clutter has definitely just expanded so far, but on the plus side I‚Äôve rediscovered my box of nitrile gloves for resin handling. Also three (3) unopened boxes of tissues (?). And most of a roll of aluminium foil.
Definitely the right time of year to get this back playing on a loop. https://mastodon.ie/@dmcgk/110831432550577662

I‚Äôve now dropped the Big Mini three separate times breaking it into twice that many pieces. It‚Äôs more metal pins and superglue than resin at this point. Probably significantly structurally more sound as a result.
Perfect winter evening reading.
Wholly inspired by your good self @rollleafd
Very much beginning to realise, in my days painting resin minis, that making dexterity my lifelong dump stat is going to have consequences.

Definitely time to start some regular creative stuff again and hope to carry hobby-momentum through into the new year.

Not the greatest start to day one though, I’m going to have to learn how to putty re-sculpt a resin-related-injury on the fuzzy fella.
Fully intending to eat one (1) entire Lindt chocolate reindeer before 10am, and not a soul can stop me.
Goal accomplished. But at what cost. What cost.
üéâ The annual rediscovery of my dedicated Christmas Stuff scissors. Instantly forgotten by New Year. “I keep what?”
It’s December 5th and I hear neighbours out with their lawnmower.
Weird modern pseudo-senses; the unheard surrounding environment just got louder as your noise-cancelling headphones automatically adjust their volume.
Trying to mimic some of the light placement on the bracer referencing Sergio‚Äôs timelapse video. Still using quite a large brush at this point due to the Unaccustomed Vastness of space.
Even just roughly blocking in the base colours is going to take the rest of my natural life‚Ä¶
‘All dolled up in gabardine / the lash-flashing Leda of pier 19 / queen of the water and queen of the old main drag’, is really quite a lyric.
Two fists deep into the first Celebrations tub of the season.
Absolutely ludicrous difference in scale between the two ‚Äòminis‚Äô currently in the WIP pile.
There’s something profane in tarnishing a pristine blank canvas.
Ooo, a box of Sergio Calvo Kickstarter miniatures just arrived. New squirrels to chase.
Chonky fren.
Sneakers may be a perfect film.
One of those days that feels like it should be snowing or sleeting or covered in ice, but it’s too bright and cloudless and dry. No weather applies correctly here, apologies for the inconvenience.
‚Ä¶and of course near immediately afterwards the arrival of darkness, rain, sleet then snow.
And lo, the world‚Äôs slowest painter of yellows picks up again his burden.
Wait‚Ä¶ why exactly are we all using acrylics? https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=W3XRwj5l3Eo
As news alerts go, I do appreciate the dedication to accuracy here.

Just remembered a Totally Normal Dream that ‘my primary foot’ starting budding off additional toes, stalks of wheat, various dried grasses and eventually metal blades.

Can’t even blame it on the clock change.

Still can‚Äôt speak French, but I‚Äôm failing to do so very consistently.

Le singe is very much indeed dans l‚Äôarbre.
A loud and howly day. The trees are outraged.
Slowly increasing purpleation and general red enyellowment.
Hmm. Not sure if this reads as cast-shadow or just brush-slip‚Ä¶
The Scavengers Reign animated series is an astonishing bit of sci-fi.

Not only did the arm snap off, I hadn‚Äôt noticed that the face didn‚Äôt even print correctly until I reached it, so a quick segue into something else entirely. Let‚Äôs keep the purple theme and see if I can ultimately get this to read as metallic.
Kinda like these reds too.
Joker: Folie √† Deux - loved it. Fully understand why some people hated it.

A friend of mine just described going for a run this morning then being physically unable to have a meeting at a standing desk with no chair.

It weirdly made me think of social-exhaustion as an introvert. It’s not just that I can’t then use my thinking and feeling parts without ‘muscle pain’ internally, but also that in external communication those mental legs won’t move correctly anymore, regardless of how hard I stick them out and try to waggle them.

Woke up from a dream of trying to buy a shirt covered in ‘Dracula stickers’ (fully awake me can no longer remember what this meant) with the thought ’not another Dracula dream’ (fully awake me can no longer remember any other Dracula dreams).
From one meme to another, definitely not painting Skeletor for an attempt at this month’s Fedipaint.

Huh, turns out I‚Äôm genuinely not painting Skeletor. I remember him as purple with yellow accents, when he is, of course, blue with purple. Is it possible I just have a weird obsession with yellow boots now?

Well that‚Äôs less than ideal. Just starting on the non-metallics and he tried to run away. Now showing one of the real downsides of resin prints - on contact with soft carpet from maybe a one metre drop, ‚Äòhis arm‚Äôs off‚Äô. Half tempted to bodge an oversize Ork power claw on there.
The absurdity continues.
Once again reminded how absurd it was that Donna Summer covered State of Independence and we all just accepted it as a totally normal holiday hit.
I am baffled and delighted at the news that Sugar is getting a second season. There’s no way that was expected to happen.
Egg-inna-mug weather.
Egg-inna-mug season.
A braver painter would just straight up Bombadil this guy.
Somewhat horrifyingly, I may be about to call my own bluff.
Anyone know of any good willow tree reference photos? Asking for a friend.

Eldest.

‚Ä¶ ?

TikTok sometimes really does surface absolute gems, and I don‚Äôt just mean the infinite cat and pupper videos. Found via the algorithm, Colin Vearncombe‚Äôs acoustic version of Wonderful Life: https://youtu.be/AqXzRTT0csI
There’s something very specifically Septembery about walking to the local post office in the driving rain.
Knowingly re-entering the transition-space between ‘I’ll just set this on the banister so I remember to take it upstairs’ and acquiring a cool new invisible banister ornament.

It‚Äôs weird that it even fits, who knows how many other things I can no longer see that I‚Äôve put there before it. Sun lotion from 2010. That pair of dedicated Amazon-box-opening scissors I bought a year or two ago.
What on earth is the link here? Smuggling? https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2019/02/15/upshot/british-irish-dialect-quiz.html
It‚Äôs basically Orktober, right? The season arrives earlier and earlier‚Ä¶

The unique zen of debugging a performance issue that I apparently introduced, finding a workaround that seemed to correct it, then only later realising the true issue pre-existed my original change and neither it nor my fix could ever actually have impacted anything at all.

A metaphor of some kind there.

I now need a word for the sense of bone-deep disappointment that I will never be able to read the continuing fictional adventures of this entirely non-fictional white-suited old man. https://assemblag.es/@hugo/113142203879640471
Uh oh, my Phrozen Sonic Mini suddenly seems to think Z0 is somewhere below the crust of the earth, and won‚Äôt let me re-level until it gets there.
The cool wind in warm sun days arrive. I have attacked some weeds in celebration.

Cannot second this recommendation from @rollleafd strongly enough if you‚Äôre a hobbyist of A Certain Vintage and want to just soak in the nostalgia of nineties-era Games Workshop before it became what it is today, direct from the brains that built it. https://warhammer.social/@rollleafd/113063302042370623
Cool and rainy, slowly darkening evenings. Looks like we’re already at that part of the year where I have to keep my delight at the change in seasons a secret.
There must already be a name for the very intense and exhausting dreams that come with the change in light and temperature at the turn of a season?

They seem to be more heavily tied to the past too, when they come. If I‚Äôm trying to find a thing, it‚Äôs in my mum‚Äôs old house. If I‚Äôm trying to explain a thing, it‚Äôs to friends I haven‚Äôt seen since school. Some deep part of the brain calcified at puberty.
Every time Congregation by Low comes up on the playlist I feel the urge to rewatch Devs.
Technically I wrote said logic, but still.

“If you want the legs of a Stegosaurus, you have to train like a Stegosaurus” «< This is a thought that sleeping-me thought so hilarious that it recurred in every dream fragment I can remember through the night.
It came up so often I started to refer to it as ‚ÄòStegometrics‚Äô.

Hiberno-English over-pronoun-ing seems to help weirdly well when memorising which verbs are reflexive in French: ‘sit yourself down’, ‘get yourself to bed’, ‘get yourself up in the morning’, ‘hurry yourself up’…
The gulls. The gulls have returned with the rain. Random bits of the house knocked on and bullied in case they’re maybe food now.
Still just a garage roof, Mr Gull. He squints at me with inhuman rage.
Completely vertical, like-pebbles-on-the-roof rain.
‚ÄúJosh, go to your office, and come up with a secret plan to fight inflation"
Phenomenally niche, but üòç for those with the need. So many paint bottle holders! https://threadboards.com/index.php

Cannot overstate how wild it is, coming from resin printing, to have a successful first print (which I can also immediately handle, with my human hands) within around 30 minutes of unboxing the Bambu A1 Mini.
My Bambu A1 mini has shipped üéâ It’ll be nice to have a way to print non-painting stuff in a way that won’t shatter into a thousand pieces under a hard stare.

One of the tracks that sometimes comes up in this random playlist gives me the same quick spike of soul-hurt as (weirdly) the intro theme to sci-fi series Raised by Wolves. It’s just only just registered: same vocalist, Mariam Wallentin.
Been a weird day for my search history. It‚Äôd be a significantly weirder one if I followed the suggestion.

Recently bought Animal Well after listening to (thankfully) the vaguest possible Besties podcast about it, so was expecting a bit of inscrutability.

‘Wow, these weird glitched screens where you need to really study the map and just inch your way across in absolute blindness are a bit hardcore’.

Dear reader: the game isn’t available for the Mac, so I was playing it via emulation. The glitches aren’t actually supposed to be there. I was too spoilerphobic to google it until about 5 hours in.
A baby Jack Black was in an episode?! ü§Ø
I‚Äôve heard the Weird Al version so many times that Gangster‚Äôs Paradise just sounds wrong to me now. See also: Ridin‚Äô Dirty.

One of this morning’s background tracks while working cut a little more deeply than expected…

üéµ

I saw a photograph, Cologne in ‘27And then a postcard after the bombs in ‘45Must’ve been a world of evil clowns that let it happenBut now I recognise, dear listenersThat you were there and so was I– Port of Morrow, The Shins
Getting massive Professor Professorson vibes from John Savage in the D√∏d Kalm episode of X-Files… and this may be the nichest possible toot.
Michael J. Anderson in Season 2! In the first episode I remember being self-awarely comedic too. Really makes me wish there‚Äôd been more Carniv√†le.
The subtle skill of backtracking in micro-bursts through whole unrecognised tracts of the audiobook I fell asleep listening to, without accidentally spoiling something for myself.
I think a cat may just have been demolished and scattered to the winds by a gang of seagulls on my roof. Or a group of large, rowdy men may just live there now.
The kind of rain that a hardboiled detective would comment on.
I didn’t realise how many Twin Peaks reunions there were in the X-Files until this rewatch. Michael Horse and Don Davis already in the first season. Both playing suspiciously similar roles.
Also Janice-from-Friends and Admiral Jarok from TNG show up! Harder to see a continuity through-line there‚Ä¶
Headaches before thunder may be the least impressive of all party tricks.
Turns out I may actually be able to predict a General Election.

Early morning heat-baked air above and the water–at this depth?–may as well be cool. Early morning white above and the water–at this depth?–may as well be night. A continuity of life, swarming things, and the background hum of men.

https://writing.exchange/@MargaretSefton/112432484491868813
All of human endeavour as tinnitus.
Birdsong‚Äîdelightfully‚Äîclearly and perfectly audible through lawnmower-cancelling headphones.
We are in full garden-coffee and Kindle season.
We must be incomprehensibly slow to all the tiny garden things. Weirdly mobile bits of invasive house.
I clearly have the slogan for my inevitable t-shirt merch.
Clearly as apt as anything else.
Reset the counter.

Made the rookie mistake of deciding to organise my hobby space, getting distracted with something else, and now having the psychological weight of ‘oh no, I need to finish all of that first’ preventing me from ever using it again…

A day of misty train journeys. Only the closest trees, largest hills and occasional clumps of confused, wandering golfers are visible. All the things are light grey and all the light grey things are now the sea and also now the sky.
Some of the golfers may have been cows.

This is phenomenally niche, but if you use full-screen apps regularly in macOS and are driven fully insane by one of those windows randomly stealing focus when you switch to one of the others:

defaults write com.apple.Dock workspaces-auto-swoosh -bool NO

(Then kill and restart the Dock)
The sound of early-morning bin lorries on a day off work giving me childhood summer holiday vibes.
There was a laundry basket in the garage «< important context. They didn‚Äôt bring the underwear with them. One assumes.
Five minutes from home and passing the courier you were expecting going the other way - an accidental zeitgeist.
The morning Billy-Pilgim-s wildly from quiet summer’s day to house-creaking winter gloom.
I realise ‘unnecessary frilly bib’ may not immediately scream grimdark, but it definitely feels like a Blanche-ism…
A warm grey morning with no wind, roof-rain without window-rain.
A perfect combination this weekend of not knowing for sure what day it is or what time.
Finally watched The Banshees of Inisherin. Very sad, very funny, black as pitch. I‚Äôd love to rewatch In Bruges, but I don‚Äôt think that would be a sane back-to-back choice.
Constellation season 1 was an absolute delight. I cannot imagine how it gets a season 2.
Constellation on Apple TV+ is the best little sci-fi mystery series I’ve seen in ages. I assume that means it’ll be immediately cancelled.
Are the button mats that people are apparently using to communicate complex ideas with their pets real, or is this the algorithms‚Äô revenge for me watching a Kate Middleton conspiracy video?
I can no longer even imagine how to read Dune without the Frog & Toad meta-commentary.
Unexpectedly complicated dreams about roast beef.
Always a profound interaction‚Ä¶
Equally weirdly: came to that conclusion when rewatching Dune, no version of which, as far as I’m aware, features Nick Cave.
(I would definitely watch that version, to be clear)
Neighbourhood car lights doing little mannered dances around each other in the rain darkness.
Season-altering rain.
Weirdly, into Autumn. Not sure if that‚Äôs a skip forward or skip back.
A ten-hour mix of Sardaukar-inspired throat singing‚Ä¶ the only downside will be trying to explain it away on Zoom calls. https://youtu.be/vNj3MdDmb80?feature=shared
I wonder if it combines well with the ten-hour Enterprise D deck-hum audio‚Ä¶
I expect to see some white dog poo next.
Quality start to this random marketing email.
‚ÄòLet‚Äôs make him think he‚Äôs back at school‚Äô
Hunting eBay for White Dwarf issues I remember from my childhood is a genuine source of delight. An endless sea of Paul Bonner and Jes Goodwin concept art and illustrations.

Books that seem to be things I’ve thought myself–pat on the back, little indulgent nod–only for us to be left mutually baffled by the end. Slightly apologetic that we weren’t who we thought we were.

Best books.

A variant of Exploding Head maybe?

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exploding_head_syndrome
Intense dreams and jetlag-brain from changing light levels. Even more of a seasonal fingerpost than the mowers.
There we have it, the second mower-whine of the day kicks off Official Spring‚Ñ¢Ô∏è. Nothing but lawn guilt now until November.
The saga continues‚Ä¶
‚ÄúThe spaghetti was just a year ago‚Äù is the perfect warning phrase for our times‚Ä¶ https://youtu.be/NXpdyAWLDas
Pricey new toaster just arrived, as a treat to myself. I may never be more middle aged than this.
Whole new worlds of browning-knob science lie ahead.
Added a short Pilates session to the New Year Fitness Regime‚Ñ¢Ô∏è yesterday and feel like someone spent all night flicking weird bits of my abdomen.
‚ÄúWhy is that bit sore?‚Äù
I would definitely read more of this mashup.
There’s a huge gull standing in a puddle across the street, just eyeballing me.
Or, potentially, the new gull-sized gap in my roof.
Definitely not ideal to hear debris rolling around inside the house in the wee small hours. Looks like at least a couple of tiles gone. Could have been worse from the noise of it.
The sound of bins being retrieved from their travels.
Excellent, a hailstorm has arrived just in time to test out my cool new roof holes.
Slightly worrying roof sounds in the Big Wind.
Something down the street a bit just made quite an expensive sounding noise.
Pretty sure the To Let sign next door will be attached to a different house in the morning.
Gulls stomping about in the snow, screaming for a fight.
Annoyingly, the thing I like most in this WIP shot is the texture palette üòÖ
Woolly-hat-indoors weather.
On the plus side: perfect for early morning garden coffee.
The gulls are out and bullying, even in the cold.
The little kid that drives my brain is 100% going to sit looking out over the back of the sofa with a big mug of tea.

Deep in that weird mental place while falling asleep last night, I happened to turn myself in bed exactly as the podcast I was no-longer-quite-listening-to played a ‘rolling’ sound. I thought I’d flicked my legs off into outer space.
Gauging early hours wind strength from how far away from driveways the bins have ended up.
A petition for chimneyscream to become an ISO standard for wind strength.
Sometimes the thing you’re failing to write is just the background mood to something else you’ll fail to write in a better way later on.
Left it a good two hours after binging on turkey to start into turkey sandwiches. Basically dieting.
Die Hard the obvious Christmas Eve film, Die Hard 2 the obvious Christmas Day film. Such a shame they never made another film in the series.
Just the zenithal prime in place here before I intended to start a base coat of contrast red, but this looks so good I‚Äôm tempted to go for an old-school pre-‚Äòbone shaded‚Äô Deathwing experiment.

I stopped sharing ‚ÄòAI art‚Äô a good while ago due to training data issues that that range all the way to outright and verifiable theft, but it‚Äôs hard to deny that it‚Äôs getting really properly good. The programmer and writer in me knows that it‚Äôs only a matter of time before my own work and hobby creativity are irreparably impacted or replaced. But the teenager that still lives deep in my brainbox knows that he would have papered every wall with drawings like this one‚Ä¶ https://mastodon.ie/@dmcgk/111629898944622888
The festive season is officially well underway now, first box of Lindt Lindor truffles opened.

“Black blood of the earth!”

Big Trouble in Little China is on everyone’s Christmas season watch list, I assume?

@MonaApp @ivory I thought it might be how boosts are handled, but having just scrolled through apparently my entire home feed for the day, then just going through my small ‚ÄòVIP‚Äô list in Mona, there are a bunch of direct posts by accounts I follow that I didn‚Äôt see.
Stressful dreams of a website with login requirements that involved solving a Rubik’s Cube and ‘performing feats of strength’.
New arrival. I may be developing a slight addiction to sci-fi movie art books.
Probably not a great sign that I could hear that wind gust through noise cancelling headphones.
Weird Dune == Best Dune
Early morning darkness into rainy winter’s day darkness. Veda bread and coffee.
Still nighttime at noon.
The blown-over-for-sale-sign man is doing his rounds.
Uncanny orange light overhead. Partial-eclipse orange through the rains.
Seems to be headed north. Santa really pulling out the stops this year.
Weird new quirk: categorising the photos I see in my Mastodon feed based on their potential future use as iMessage stickers.
Strangely cold today, while being exactly the same temperature as yesterday. Wind chill somehow breaching the walls, Day After Tomorrow style.
Midnight at 5.30pm. Proper Winter knocking on the door.
Time to engage the secret third combined weight of the duvet.

The low sun with hedge swaying at the rear and tree at the front occasionally show me giants in the corner of my eye. Dancing their way around the house.

I only notice and look up when they seem to stop and loom.
@bens Any vim-based Advent-of-Coding streams planned this year?
Urgently loud winter hail.
The delighted sound of neighbours‚Äô kids convinced it‚Äôs snow.
Cacophony of birds out back, they seem to be shouting down a small dog.
Blinding, low winter sun season appears to be here. Alongside deep and exhausting seasonal dreams.

I’ve a habit of setting things I don’t immediately need in some utterly random place that still seems ‘obvious’ in the moment.

Does not work well in the middle of Christmas Tree Setup clutter.
I‚Äôm sure I‚Äôll find those scissors again this time next year.
And again. A whole string of leds banished to the negarealm.
‚Ä¶ they were, of course, tucked neatly and lovingly beyond the scope of human vision between two books on a bookshelf. The proper domain of scissors.
Weaponised autumn leaves shotgunning my front windows.
Denying the heating system its little victory by getting out my thermals.

One of the eerier strangenesses of our new autocomplete-based reality is that our tools now need to speak to each other like people.

Using the ChatGPT app rather than a browser appears to leak the prompt used to structure a response to the user when images have been generated.
Can’t hear the opening to I’m Deranged without seeing yellow text over that infinite black road.
Un monsieur triste en costume.
A slow and wobbly train on a slow and wobbly day.
Uh oh. Realising now that I am at an age where a wobbly train means constant vigilance against dozing.
October skies, late-August temperatures.

Waking up from: navigating a vast and serpentine bathroom with freestanding shower-wall baffles, in search of a small box of compostable recycling bags at the other end. An ominous sense that someone else was in there.
Weirdly middle-class Lovecraftian angst as a genre.
Deep cleaning parts of my kitchen I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôve even seen as long as I‚Äôve lived here. My eyebrows are sweating.
There‚Äôs a tiny little half-hidden cupboard here that I apparently exiled some unfavoured glasses to ~fifteen years ago. I wonder what adventures they‚Äôve been on.

Mad October Dreams (early start this year).

Part of a massive group of middle aged men being taught to swim in a pool beside the sea, while planning for an all-belly tattoo that I didn’t really want. Oddly comradely.

(Unintentionally) failing to tend the clean sock stockpile -> (unintentionally) wearing waterproof socks as last option -> (unintentionally) emptying a basin of water over my feet.

There was a victory of sorts here today, but I don’t think I can claim it.
A very pebbley rain.

The perfectly normal realisation that you’ve been mournfully humming the slowed-down Tethered Mix of I Got 5 On It from Us.

Possibly for days.
Into the days of waking up in darkness again.
This one at least partly rain-induced. May not count for professional scoring.

One of those slick-grey starts to the day that feels infinitely long.

You could move the clock but you’d definitely need special shoes.
Considering moving house and suddenly my year’s-worth hoard of undumped Amazon boxes seems like logistical genius.
Would it be weird to pack books in 24-pack Coke Zero boxes?
The real pro-strat has been in cunningly only buying Coke-Zero-shaped books for the last 15 years.
Apparently I‚Äôve been keeping a bunch of broken desk lamps and old DVD players in The Cupboard That I Studiously Ignore. Bonus: found a copy of Moon that I didn‚Äôt remember owning.
Untold hundreds of travel adapters.
On a train. Literally brought sweatbands with me.
Drama-queen clouds over the lough earlier. Not visible: walking-in-the-rain levels of humidity.
It‚Äôs so warm that my bewildered house is making its deep midsummer groans.
The view out front is clearly autumn but the back garden is baking in a summer‚Äôs day. Spiders apparently chasing flies from one to the other.
Slowly trying to add some colour and texture differentiation. I want to push towards a dirty, patinaed gold for the metal.
‚ÄúI‚Äôve been in this room before‚Äù‚Äîmy childhood terror at the holodeck scene from ‚ÄòSchisms‚Äô continues to add a tingly piquant on rewatches.

There’s a comforting thok-thok-thok out there of a neighbour doing something maintenancey to their house. I may clean the kitchen in solidarity.

You and me, productive stranger.

Like most of ex-birdsite iOS, I resisted but ultimately followed @stroughtonsmith down the rathole of getting back into mini painting as a kinda harmless midlife crisis… somehow I now own a 3D printer.
Currently trying to grok non-metallic metal. Baffled by how well it seems to be going.
This beautiful beast has just arrived.

Is there a genre of film which is just pre-horror horror? Something with the vibe of The Shining before all the spook-em-ups. Vaguely banal but off-kilter normalcy, with the sense of something coming.
For some reason my brain goes to Zodiac. It must be 99% vibe.
How am I only now learning that there are ten hour long YouTube videos of Norwegian train journeys to the Arctic circle? Peak content ‚ù§Ô∏è https://youtu.be/3rDjPLvOShM
Tunnels!
Already considering if a single TV in the house could be dedicated to one of these on a loop. Any time, day or night, train-room-and-chill.
Finding the permanent-train-chill video the day after I discovered that TikTok can be a dedicated provider of goofy animal videos. I have quite the weekend ahead.

A comfortable, on-for-the-evening rain.

There‚Äôs a tick-tickety-tick drip-onto-metal out there, purposefully unidentified. It kicks in as some saturation point is hit; ‚Äúthis can‚Äôt be argued with, get thee to a sofa‚Äù.
Just wrote a unit test that included an ‚Äòexpected‚Äô variable and a ‚Äòfeared‚Äô variable.
Weird dreams of knitting tag and search term metadata into my jumpers.
Just windy enough for every green thing to ripple.
Wait, it‚Äôs autumn again somehow? Did we forget a couple of seasons last year?
Maybe the problem is with me.
TFW it drops from 11¬∞C above seasonal highs to a mere 3¬∞ above and you start to eye the winter jumpers.
Wearing an Apple Watch for sleep tracking always comes with the risk of accidentally discovering you‚Äôre haunted.
A gentle Sunday rain, quieting everything down.
I‚Äôm sure this is fine.
Waking up to heat, pouring rain and a bout of vertigo; a thick and spongy day.
T-shirt and raincoat weather. Sweating in baffled resentment.
An army of tiny spiders avoiding puddles on a sunny bin lid.
First week at the new job complete, no (serious) permanent psychological damage logged. A-, will work again next week.
First train of the day. Sleepy birds watching and judging.
Final train of the day. Happy moo cows in the sun.

On a long train journey to an unfamiliar destination tomorrow‚Ä¶ seems like the perfect setting to start into @mjohnharrison ‚Äòs latest.

(Cutting mat, hobby knife and oil paint not strictly necessary)

@robotspacer I just got to the portion of your Hugo 2 stream where you talked about misremembering your age all year‚Ä¶ not only do I now realise I‚Äôve been doing exactly the same thing, I‚Äôve been doing so at exactly the same age.
On the last train trip to my current place of work. Uninterrupted blue skies and sun. Weather‚Äôs pretty nice too.
@ocoog Eyyy, an Owen appears! (I assume!)
@briancam A Brian is here!
The delicate little balance of joyful abject terror between the last day at one job and the first at another.

Today in middle-aged shopping: a US quart is a different size from a UK quart, a useful thing to know when buying new sealing rings for your Instant Pot (the capacity of which you previously only knew in litres).

Carless (by choice) for the first time in around thirty years (triple checked that duration, still feels impossible).

I wonder how long the empty-driveway-it’s-been-stolen-!, mini heart attack phase lasts.

Changing jobs after 21 years… me-from-the-beforetimes would be startled by that alone, nevermind simultaneously:

a) getting rid of my car (‘commutes’, such a pre-COVID concept)

b) wondering if I can get to retirement age before LLMs destroy the need for literally any of my learned skills (either career or hobby)
Yappy dogs at distant rumbles silent as the actual thunder rolls over.
It definitely left new holes up there.
It’s getting weird out there, the sound is popping-and-boomingly continuous.
It’s like multiple distant storms are shooting artillery at each other in a rota.
All under a fake nighttime.
Tiny, faraway winds, raging at bedtime.
Could be thunder, could be a series of vans hitting the same pothole.
Ohhh, likely thunder then, as the sky splits apart directly overhead.
Maybe it‚Äôs age, but thunder is starting to sound a lot meaner here in the future.
Pyjama bottoms and hoodie at 4pm on my day off. Is it possible to relax too strenuously?
Benefits of emergency alert test day: rediscovering all the Apple kit you’d forgotten about, after the heart attack dies down.
Roc attack-silhouettes from back-garden hedge birdies time of year.

@april Hi April, just checking in that everything is okay with you since it looks like you haven‚Äôt posted anything in almost a week - on the other hand if it‚Äôs a planned break from the relentless perfectionist pace you set yourself then definitely enjoy it!
Managed to somehow hurt the exact centre of my back while asleep, during dreams, as far as I can remember, spent strenuously trying to recall Willem Dafoe’s name.
Weirdly, I was convinced he had played John Constantine, referring to him as ‚ÄúJudge John Constantine‚Äù, in what could only be the Constantine/Judge John Deed mashup the world so clearly needs.

Just got some surprisingly positive feedback from a short story competition earlier in the year, despite, on a re-read, now realising how completely unhinged it was.

“They drink their drinks and defecate happily.” « genuinely the final line of the story.

Is it weird that every now and again I get the theme tune to GoBots running around my head? Specifically, as sung by Timmy Mallett.

I didn’t even watch the cartoon.
Hammering with its tiny, tiny fists.

Just heard what sounded like an old timey stream train whistle being pursued by a police siren.

Is it possible to be haunted by Looney Tunes?
Get-up-and-look-outside-worriedly levels of rain noise.
‚ÄúIs someone emptying a skipful of sand on my roof?‚Äù
Oddly stressful dreams of wandering supermarket aisles looking for the new AI-powered chocolate.
Sufficient moody rain to summon a Batman.
Ah yes, bin day tomorrow, announces the unexpectedly windy night.
Tiny snow falling thickly.
The impotent hard ting of icy rain when already snuggly immune.
The little section of my back garden that the birds routinely attack also appears to retain snow after a melt.

Lynch’s Lost Highway, a darkened room, a wintry evening.

A non-zero chance my sanity won’t hold.
100% did not remember Richard Pryor or Marilyn Manson being in that film‚Ä¶ feels like entirely distinct eras overlapping.
Also, Bill Pullman moves himself around as though powered by supermarionation, and I in no way mean that as an insult.
It’s not really snowing, more raining directly into ice.
When you know before opening the blinds that there’s been snow overnight from the increase in reflected light.
Another day of accidentally making myself a nice cup of steamed milk instead of actual coffee…
Just folded close and sealed up a package and now blood is streaming from both of my hands despite them interacting with nothing but cardboard.
There may be a point where an absurd lack of physical dexterity becomes life threatening.
It’s so unseasonably bright and mild that I’m already being peer-pressured into cutting the grass by the sound of other people’s lawnmowers.
Rewatching Columbo and every male lead has a voice that sounds like it actively hurts to use.
I think Andor may have broken all other TV sci-fi for me.
(Other than Severance)

The blandly grey days between two winters, a Northern Irish tale.

(Except the bit in the middle when it‚Äôs briefly too bright to see)

That slightly dazed level of tiredness when your eyes start to snag on things; you’re not looking quite where you intended, just somewhere along the way, stopped at something too visually heavy to get all the way past. Sometimes mid conversation.
The inability to read properly in dreams feels like it’s solving the same problem as the no-signal/broken phone trope in modern horror.
Just cobbled together an accessibility ramp for a spider trapped in the bath. It has retreated further into the bath.
I like the impossible vastness of the bath implied there.
The kind of winds that you hear at a slight remove. Somewhere just above, probably the other side of the street. Giant balls of atmosphere rolling.

@palmin I used to see fairly regular failures in Shellfish when trying to re-authenticate after it having been backgrounded for a while, but over the last few days it‚Äôs like the connection is always already open again as soon as I switch back - I thought it might be a recent fix related to wake-on-LAN, but the only mention I see in the changelogs is from months ago. Regardless, a big thank you!

Weird stray memories from the brain-cooking of a slight head-cold - the primary (nightmare inducing) worry that I had as a child, I‚Äôm sure over multiple years, was that I would somehow get my head stuck between railings.
It hit a balmy 10¬∞C today and I, genuinely, bought a box of ice lollies.
That sentence construction immediately makes me think of this: https://mastodon.ie/@oisinmcgann/109399869638841740
Just stripped the detachable lower-tog layer of my duvet. A couple of weeks with actually-cold weather and my body has started rejecting all human norms for temperature.

I am ludicrously late to this, but The Beef And Dairy Network Podcast is an absolute delight.

http://www.beefanddairynetwork.com/

My first prompt: a crime caper in a kindergarten featuring a proud mother‚Ä¶

So just your bog-standard Muppet Babies / Oceans 11 mashup.
A compound word for the growing intuition of your own internal physical structure based on the parts that become audible over time.
MacBook-chassis-causes-pain weather.
One of those days when the ground is brighter than the sky.
Tiny hail that sounds like sand falling.
Snowfall! And the muffled, distant complaints of birds.
Neighbourhood cats hiding under cars.
One just tried to break into my garage in disgust. Didn‚Äôt like the look of it. Don‚Äôt entirely blame them.
Better to be caught in a blizzard than face those two ancient mattresses and whatever might now lurk inside the broken, abandoned freezer.
Kids in hugely padded hoods playing in a half-inch of snow under a streetlight. You forget the gloriousness of weather as you get older.
The end of my first week back at work after a three week break and I‚Äôve managed to sleep strenuously enough to hurt my eyes.
We have entered the Screaming Chimney days of windy winter.
I‚Äôd forgotten how the Big Christmas Tree acted as a diffuser. At this time of year any unobscured sunlight comes in through the rear window like a laser.
It‚Äôs the season of accidental shiny-surface-induced blindness.
Yet a single meaty cloud passes and you no longer have enough light to see across the room.
The perfect winter’s evening reading soundtrack: loud-enough-to-be-heard wind and empty-sounding streets.
December is when I started to follow mainly photographers and artists on Mastodon rather than predominantly just the same old ‚Äòopinionated tech‚Äô folks from the other site. No regrets.

Ah, here we go, the first vague anxiety of the new year: wondering if the neighbours silently judge me for the Christmas lights still blazing from every surface inside the house like a lighthouse beam.
The precious discovery of an unopened, family-size box of Maltesers that mysteriously survived Christmas.
Strong winds and the low winter sun turning trees into disco balls.

“His eyes seemed to root back under all the bulk of that forehead, too thick, too jammy, all full of resistive meats and fluids; exhausting to cut into sections, should such a thing come up.”

I think I may have the turkey sweats.
All Christmas mini-rolls already consumed well before Christmas Day, regardless of the amount stockpiled. The great tradition continues.
Wondered why I could see a reflection of a cat in the TV. Probably time to trim the beard a tad.
Lovecraftian office space.
Long abandoned technology.

Something I wasn‚Äôt expecting with ChatGPT is its non-trivial use in gamifying ‚Äòthe blank page‚Äô.

As a non-writer sounding board you can feed it some half-thought-through notion for a story, ask it to produce an outline or where to start, then essentially find ways to do the opposite.

If it produces a standard, formulaic approach to an idea, you can then tear that apart, or invert it. You can much more easily see your story, the one that it wouldn‚Äôt tell.
@5eanmcd not the Sean McDermott I know from The Real World?!

A little while ago I was sharing the Stable-Diffusion-generated images I use as visual writing prompts–in case they were of any use to others–but stopped when the ‘AI art’ debate really kicked off.

Taking a cue from @Curator and the .art instance guidelines, I may re-start sharing but will self-impose the same basic rules: they’ll be behind a content warning, with an hashtag, noting the generator used. Nothing I post here uses any artist styles in the prompt.
Unexpected ruins.
Is there a term like nerdsniping that applies to fiction writers when presented with an endless, winter photography stream of isolated, spooky roads?

Disused, disintegrating factories and schools, near-empty night-time train platforms, odd stones in the hills, distortions seen through glass. All those agoraphobically-vast interior spaces and claustrophobically-forested exterior spaces–the shared art that I find most compelling and comforting here is an almost-overlapping set with childhood bad dreams.
Managed to somehow punch the inside (?) front wall (??) of my washing machine while (quite sedately) lifting clothes into it. Possibly as hard as I‚Äôve punched anything in my life.
Now remembering the time I caused myself year-long lower back pain by standing up from a sofa the wrong way.
The kind of day you can hear the weight of things; cars panting quietly, crackling over the thin snow-on-ice crust.
I‚Äôve never had any interest in Instagram, but so much of what I follow on Mastodon turns out to be superb, starkly moody photography by superb (starkly moody?) photographers.

@mjohnharrison is your Audible version of the Viriconium series no longer being sold? I was hoping to gift it to someone but the landing page says it isn‚Äôt available: https://www.audible.co.uk/pd?asin=B006L88LBA&source_code=ASSORAP0511160006&share_location=pdp
Doors to nowhere.
Mediaeval gigafactories (of the high gothic style) (defunct).
Figures of uncertain intent, obscured by mist.
The forest makes its own light.

‚ÄúYou‚Äôll die. There‚Äôs always a chance… but in all honesty, you‚Äôll die.‚Äù

‚ÄúI am a scholar of the fort.‚Äù

‚ÄúMelodrama?‚Äù

‚ÄúSelf-realisation.‚Äù

‚ÄúMelodrama.‚Äù

They walked another loop through the wide, shallow bowl near the overlap with normalcy, through the little spikes of ice-in-the-nethers clarity brought on by the inversion of it all: the once slow-rise into the hill-that-was, now a scarred, shallow indentation. Flaps of excess skin sewn up after excising the cyst. It seemed exactly as overgrown, exactly as furrowed and ploughed-through as on the day of the event, the day of the absence of event.
I had no idea feed reading was starting to properly evolve again. Feedbin now supports Twitter as a source alongside email, rss/Atom/json and directly enables link/quote-style microblogging!

I’ve never liked the overhead of dealing with responsive image sets in Markdown when writing for the web. I’ve now set up the current version of this site to expect any image links as a simple list as part of the yaml header, rather than within the main body of the post, which is processed further by Jekyll at compile-time.

Since I only need to do this part once it can be as complex and edge-casey as I need while keeping the actual written content short and clean.
2017, the year of the handwritten, artisanal tweet.
So @ulyssesapp@social.ulysses.app goes subscription–after reading their reasoning, I think it’s a great idea. Easily the best writing tool I’ve ever used.
üòõüëç @ulyssesapp as Twitter client! @workflowhq adds @jekyllrb yaml, posts to @workingcopyapp, rss read by @microdotblog, ‘Goal’ set < 140.
Hmm, is this new with the iOS 11 beta? Apple have added Dropbox-like collaboration for non-iWork arbitrary files stored in iCloud Drive?
The single most terrifying thing I can recall from my childhood: The Owl Service.

item.title: iThoughts textpack support
item.description: The new .textpack support in @toketaware’s iThoughts imports well into @ulyssesapp.

Not everyone makes use of the existing ‘Lion-style’ full-screen mode in os x—if you have a particularly large monitor, or just prefer having multiple overlapping windows visible at the same time, then you may see it as a waste of screen real estate—yet the tech world has seen a real growth over the last few years in applications and tools which are built with the goal of reducing distraction and increasing focus.

For os x users, dedicated Spaces for full-screen apps can be an easy, built-in solution to that same problem of keeping your attention on a single activity. The upcoming Split View full-screen mode under os x 10.11 ‘El Capitan’ has the potential to be a nice expansion of the same idea.

One of the main reasons to use [Markdown][#markdown] is to avoid any issues of layout, visual composition or rendering until after the actual content has been written. Unfortunately, when publishing something for the web, issues such as how content will display on different categories of devices do eventually need to be thought about. Image syntax in particular can be cumbersome in Markdown if you need to do something more complex than just specifying a single image and alt text.

This is a static website—the content you’re reading now is generated once, for all visitors, then presented in the same way each time for each browser request. That’s slightly different from the (current) internet norm of generating content as it’s requested, possibly on a targeted per-user basis, and probably using a database or some server-side business logic. Think of Wordpress and its plugins as examples of the latter, while Pelican, Jekyll, and Octopress would be examples of the former.
